title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or translations and to score the response.

One point is awarded for each correctly translated segment. The student must correctly translate all words in a given segment to receive credit for that segment.

Note: The passage is segmented in such a way as to achieve a balance of easy, medium, and hard segments. Glosses are added to the passage only in order to make a given segment easier, so uncommon words in harder segments will not necessarily be glossed.

Note: The model translation provided below is merely a suggestion of how the passage might accurately be translated. Teachers should use their discretion in accepting alternative translations of any given segment.
descriptions:
The response does not accurately include any of the translations below.

· Segment 1: Erant omnino [(there) were, existed (if not taken impersonally); altogether, in total, in all, only]

· Segment 2: itinera duo [paths, ways, passages, roads, routes, journeys (must be plural); two (must modify itinera)]

· Segment 3: quibus itineribus [by (means of) which, on which (must modify itineribus); paths, ways, passages, roads, routes, journeys]

· Segment 4: domo exire possent [(their) home(s), house(s); leave (from), depart (from), go (out of, from), exit (from), abandon; they/the Helvetii were/would be/might be/may be able to, they/the Helvetii could]

· Segment 5: unum per Sequanos [one (path); (was) through, by; the Sequani, (the territory of) the Sequani]

· Segment 6: angustum et difficile [narrow, thin; and; difficult, hard]

· Segment 7: inter montem Iuram et flumen Rhodanum [among, between; mountain(s); the Iura (must modify montem); and; river; the Rhone, Rhodanus (must modify flumen)]

· Segment 8: vix qua [scarcely, hardly, barely, with difficulty; where, by (means of) which, on which, along which]

· Segment 9: singuli carri [individual, single, singular, one-by-one, one-at-a-time (must modify carri); wagons, carts (must be plural)

· Segment 10: ducerentur [could be/can be/might be/may be/would be/were (being) led, drawn, dragged, driven]

· Segment 11: mons autem altissimus [mountain(s); however, but, moreover; very tall, very lofty, very high, tallest, loftiest, highest (must be superlative)]

· Segment 12: impendebat [hung over, overhung, stood over, threatened, loomed, impended, was/were hanging over, overhanging, standing over, threatening, looming, impending]

· Segment 13: facile perpauci [easily, readily; (a very) few (men/people) (must be nominative)]

· Segment 14: ut prohibere possent [so that, with the result that, such that; stand in the way, prevent, hinder, prohibit, stop (them); might be/were able to, could]

· Segment 15: alterum per provinciam nostram [the other, another, second, alternate (route was) (must be nominative); through; province, territory, county, land; our (must modify provinciam]
